description: The `Application & Job Orchestrator` subsystem is responsible for the overall application lifecycle, including job initiation, execution flow management, and the persistence of analysis jobs. It acts as the central coordinator, handling argument parsing, orchestrating calls to other components, and managing the final output generation, specifically including diagram generation. Its boundaries are defined by the main application entry point, the local job management, job data persistence, and the coordination of specific output generators like the `DiagramGenerator`.

components.name: Application Entrypoint & Workflow Orchestrator
components.description: Serves as the primary entry point for the application, responsible for parsing command-line arguments, validating inputs, and initiating the overall high-level workflow for both remote and local repository processing. It orchestrates the sequence of operations for the documentation generation pipeline.

components.name: Local Job Lifecycle Manager
components.description: Manages the complete lifecycle of documentation generation jobs specifically within the local application environment. This includes making, starting, processing, and generating specific outputs (e.g., onboarding materials), and handling the creation and removal of temporary working directories for repositories.

components.name: Job Data Persistence Manager
components.description: Provides an interface for persistent storage and retrieval of all job-related data, including job creation, status updates, and traceability information, utilizing DuckDB for efficient data management.

components.name: Diagram Generation Coordinator
components.description: Coordinates the generation of visual representations, specifically Mermaid.js diagrams, based on architectural insights extracted from code analysis. It acts as an interface for the orchestrator to trigger and manage diagram creation as a key output.
